title: Howling at the Sun
body:
King Rhaegar orders two weddings to reunite the kingdoms after Robert Baratheon’s rebellion failed. Oberyn/OC.

The day after they left King’s Landing

Just below Prince’s Pass, the Dornish camp was set up for the night. It had been tiring travelling so quickly from King’s Landing, away from Rhaegar’s insistence that they stayed, but now that…

Read more…

summary: Nobody could handle the finale of the BBC’s crime thriller ‘Bodyguard’
title: Nobody could handle the finale of the BBC’s crime thriller ‘Bodyguard’
body:
At one point on Sunday night, a solid 11 million people were tuned in to watch the finale of the BBC’s nail-chewingly tense crime thriller Bodyguard.

A whole bunch of them were tweeting about it, too. Just a quick glance through the #Bodyguard hashtag was enough to see just how much of an impact Jed Mercurio’s six-parter, which has recently been sold to Netflix, made. 

SEE ALSO: 9 of the best British films you’ve never seen

In the run-up to the final episode, UK politicians had their priorities straight.

Ok sorry I’m parking the #PeoplesVote and the #LabourPartyConference worthy as they are! Back in my hotel room so excited for #TheBodyguard

— David Lammy (@DavidLammy) September 23, 2018

As the action played out, people were struggling to cope.

I didn’t think it was possible to not breathe for 75 minutes… #Bodyguard pic.twitter.com/fZmbJJwH8t

— Love, Ollie 🏳️‍🌈🇪🇺 (@OllieCharles) September 23, 2018

No nails left #Bodyguard pic.twitter.com/mUpfaZRL4g

— Kerry-Lynne Pyke MCIPR 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁷󠁬󠁳󠁿 (@kerrylynnepyke) September 23, 2018

This is more tense than when Georgia was waiting for Josh to come back to the villa and he turned up with Kaz #bodyguard

— Lauren Franklin (@Franklinsays) September 23, 2018

Others, meanwhile, were picking up valuable espionage techniques.

*watches #bodyguard*

*hides secret Jaffa Cake stash in boiler* pic.twitter.com/ZpGZV68vo7

— simon buschenfeld (@buschenfeld) September 23, 2018

After seeing the technique used so effectively in #Bodyguard, I’ve started hiding important items behind my boiler so nobody else can find them pic.twitter.com/vp33FScUTN

— Joe (@jawtonloe) September 23, 2018

Ultimately, the episode left a lot of people feeling shaken, but satisfied.

Wooooooah. Like seriously. Oh my goodness. That whole final episode was INSANE. What an incredible series. #Bodyguard pic.twitter.com/SDxNwovrA7

— Jodie (@Jodieee21) September 23, 2018

#Bodyguard British TV at its best!! @BBCOne

— Chizzy (@chizzyakudolu) September 23, 2018

Turning #bodyguard’s final moments into a touching moment about men’s mental health has just totally got me and makes this truly the best of British programming ❤️ #Itsoknottobeok pic.twitter.com/c5cElRTzVl

— Michael Pearson (@MPJourno) September 23, 2018

(Although some had a few key observations about the show’s final moments.)

How more British can you get that the final scenes in the biggest drama series in 20 years are a trip to occupational health and driving away in a Nissan. #bodyguard

— Tommo Walters (@Tommyblx) September 23, 2018

David Budd put himself on the line for National Security. The amount of shit he had to deal with in a short space of time and he’s rolling around in a 10 plate Nissan Qashqai. Poor bastard #Bodyguard

— Michael Webb (@MjwebbDREAM) September 23, 2018

Solid work, BBC.

157 crew.
88 shoot days.
56 cast.
23 stunt performers.
6 episodes.
2 directors.
1 writer.
1 epic finale.

Thanks for watching #Bodyguard on @BBCOne. ❤️ pic.twitter.com/X7WwvAXfXg

— BBC One (@BBCOne) September 23, 2018

Bodyguard is coming to Netflix on October 24, so if you’re reading this in the U.S. you’ll definitely want to mark that date in your calendar. The main character is Richard Madden, who played Robb in Game of Thrones, so what more could you ask for?

WATCH: The folks behind this ‘Game of Thrones’ tapestry stan harder than you

Read more: https://mashable.com/article/bodyguard-bbc-reactions/

The post Nobody could handle the finale of the BBC’s crime thriller ‘Bodyguard’ appeared first on Viral TV News.



from WordPress http://www.viraltvnews.com/game_of_thrones/nobody-could-handle-the-finale-of-the-bbcs-crime-thriller-bodyguard/

summary: [SPOILERS] I think Emilia Clarke has gotten better throughout the show
title: [SPOILERS] I think Emilia Clarke has gotten better throughout the show
body:
Firstly, I think the writing for her character in the earlier seasons after Drogo’s death wasn’t stellar either which doesn’t help, they often had her looking stoic episode after episode and I think they could’ve done a much better job letting her show more emotions.

So from S2 to S5 I thought she was alright, not bad but not close to some of the best ones (Peter, Lena, Charles, Diana, etc), some scenes she did a good job but her acting didn’t really stand out most of the time. However in S6 and S7 I really enjoyed her acting, particularly in S7 when she starts to open up I think that fits Emilia a lot more and I thought she was actually really good this past season.

On a side note, I thought her acting when Viserion died and then later when Jon bends the knee was on point, add to that there’s nothing actually there, it’s all CGI and a green screen, which makes it harder.

Overall, though I never thought she was doing a bad job in those seasons, I could understand why some people didn’t like her acting, that’s not the case anymore, imo she’s improved a lot over the course of the show.

​



Source: https://ift.tt/2C8MMvN

Firstly, I think the writing for her character in the earlier seasons after Drogo’s death wasn’t stellar either which doesn’t help, they often had her looking stoic episode after episode and I think they could’ve done a much better job letting her show more emotions.

So from S2 to S5 I thought she was alright, not bad but not close to some of the best ones (Peter, Lena, Charles, Diana, etc), some scenes she did a good job but her acting didn’t really stand out most of the time. However in S6 and S7 I really enjoyed her acting, particularly in S7 when she starts to open up I think that fits Emilia a lot more and I thought she was actually really good this past season.

On a side note, I thought her acting when Viserion died and then later when Jon bends the knee was on point, add to that there’s nothing actually there, it’s all CGI and a green screen, which makes it harder.

Overall, though I never thought she was doing a bad job in those seasons, I could understand why some people didn’t like her acting, that’s not the case anymore, imo she’s improved a lot over the course of the show.

​



Source: https://ift.tt/2C8MMvN

title: On The King's Road
body:
On The King’s Road

Family vacation time!

From July 31st to August 14th, my family (minus my brother, the traitor) and I went to Ireland, doing the first family road trip we’ve ever done (seriously, you missed something, brother).

In case you haven’t caught up on it yet, Frodo’s and my vacations are – although always fun! – not the kind of story to share around the campfire for the insanely fun times…

… I…

View On WordPress
